meanings.definition: Resembling a sack in shape or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The sacklike bag hung loosely from her shoulder.
meanings.sent2: The fabric was so loose and sacklike that it draped over the chair.
meanings.sent3: The sacklike costume made him look like a walking potato!
meanings.sent4: The clouds were sacklike, bulging with rain ready to burst.
meanings.sent5: The old house had a sacklike roof, sagging in the middle.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of a sack.
meanings.sent1: The sacklike material was rough and coarse to the touch.
meanings.sent2: His movements were slow and sacklike, as if carrying a heavy load.
meanings.sent3: The sacklike behavior of the sleepy cat made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a sacklike quality, deep and muffled.
meanings.sent5: The room had a musty smell, sacklike and stale.
